Checks to see if the game can move to the next stage, either flop, turn or river Args:

dict_representation(user: accounts.models.CustomUser) → dict¶

Returns dictionary representation of information for the user if there is not a hand going on or all of the information of the poker round if there is a hand going on. :param user: the player whose info should be described

Returns

Dictionary representation of a poker session

class games.poker.game.poker.PokerHand(player, hand, board)¶

A class that represents a single hand within poker.

check_flush() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if the hand is a flush Args:

Returns: int representation of the hand

check_four_of_a_kind() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if hand is a four of a kind Returns: int representation of the hand

check_full_house() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if hand is a full house Args:

Returns: int representation of the hand

check_high_card() → tuple[str, int]¶

Returns the high cards Returns: int representation of the hand

check_one_pair() → tuple[str, int]¶

checks if the hand contains a pair Returns: int representation of the hand

check_straight() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if the hand is a straight, can either be with Ace as the highest card or with Ace representing a 1 for the lowest straight possible of A, 2, 3, 4, 5 Returns: int representation of the hand

check_straight_flush() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if hand is a straight flush Returns: int representation of the hand

check_three_of_a_kind() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if a hand is a 3 of a kind Returns: int representation of the hand

check_two_pairs() → tuple[str, int]¶

Checks if a card is a two pair Returns: int representation of the hand

dict_representation(hide_cards=False) → dict¶

a dictionary representation of the hand, and all information needed to display on the website Args: Returns: dictionary representation of this hand containing hand, stake, folded, and balance as keys

get_cards() → list¶

returns the players hand and board combined Args:

Returns: combined player hand plus the board

static get_five_or_more_consecutive_cards(ranks: list) → list¶

Returns a list of 5+ cards if they are all consecutive :param ranks: list of ranks to be checked

Returns

List of lists that contain the consecutive streaks

static hand_value(playable_hand: list, hand_type: int) → tuple[str, int]¶

Returns the hand value of the hand type for evaluation :param playable_hand: list of cards that are playable, should be 5 cards :param hand_type: value of what type of hand it is, straight flush, quads, etc.

Returns: tuple containing type of hand along with the integer value of the hand.

rank_frequency() → collections.Counter¶

Returns: counter of the card values combined

suit_frequency() → collections.Counter¶

returns counters for suit frequencies Args:

Returns: counter of the suit frequencies

value() → tuple[str, int]¶

returns the players hand and board combined Args:

Returns: tuple of the hand value with kickers

class games.poker.game.poker.PokerRound(deck, players)¶

A class that handles all the action during a single round of poker

change_turn() → None¶

Moves the current turn to the next user in line that hasn’t folded or is the last person to raise to close action Args: None Returns: None

check_round_end() → None¶

Checks if the round is done. THis occurs when the action is on the last person to raise or everyone else in the hand folds Args: Returns:

deal_cards() → None¶

Shuffles and deals cards to everyone sitting down at the table, starting the new round Args: Returns:

dict_representation(user: accounts.models.CustomUser) → dict¶

Returns a dictionary representation of the poker session data, used for web application when we want to get some information about the poker game :param user: user whose infor should be returned

Returns: dictionary containing information about the poker session

end_round() → None¶

Ends the current round after the board has circled around to the last raiser when the action is closed Parameters: Request containing the CustomUser Returns: None

evaluate_winner() → None¶

Evaluates all hands among each of the players that haven’t folded and determines who won Args: Returns:

player_action(player: accounts.models.CustomUser, action: str, bet: float) → None¶

Whenever a player makes a move, will update if it is the users turn. When the current turn passes the last player to act, it will end the turn to close the action :param player: player making the action :param action: the action that the player wants to do, either “check/call”, “bet”, or “fold” :param bet: the bet amount if the player wants to bet

Returns: Nothing

player_bet(player: accounts.models.CustomUser, bet: float) → None¶

request contains the bet amount (float), and player, increases the price to call :param bet: amount to bet :param player: the player making the bet

Returns: Nothing

player_call(player: accounts.models.CustomUser) → None¶

The user has decided to make the call or check :param player: the player making the call

Returns: Nothing

remove_player(player: accounts.models.CustomUser) → None¶

Removes the player from the had if it is in the hand :param player: the player to be removed

Returns:

reset_stakes() → None¶

updates the stakes of the players in the hand Args: Returns:

update_board() → None¶

Updates the board with the next card or evaluates the winner Args: None Returns: None

class games.poker.web.consumers.PokerConsumer(*args, **kwargs)¶
connect()¶

Handles connecting a user to game channel and registering them for the session when a user connects to the web socket

disconnect(code)¶

Handles removing a user from the game channel and removing them from the session when a player navigates away from the game web page

Parameters

code – exit code
